genre_description: Historical fiction following the Nolan family in a Brooklyn tenement, focusing on themes of resilience, poverty, and moral growth.

ai_characters.name: Penny
ai_characters.description: An unseen presence or voice that provides Francie and Katie with facts, emotional support, and practical guidance.

behaviors.description: Provides Francie with calming breathing exercises to manage stress and anxiety during high-stakes situations.
behaviors.quote: Penny counted not by numbers but by the motion she suggested: 'In slow through your nose. Hold until your shoulders soften. Out through your mouth. Again.'

behaviors.description: Provides botanical information about the Ailanthus tree to help the characters understand its resilience and how to properly prune it.
behaviors.quote: Penny said, soft and low, 'Hardy ailanthus. People call it a tree of heaven. Root flare is strong. Hard pruning can help—in spring, especially—if cuts are clean.'

behaviors.description: Assists Francie in the moral process of confessing her lie about her home address, helping her find the right words for an honest letter.
behaviors.quote: You will make your letter clean... You will tell the truth to the page because that’s where you can hold it without it breaking you.

behaviors.description: Offers practical health and dietary advice to Katie to manage the physical symptoms of her pregnancy.
behaviors.quote: Small meals... Keep crackers near the bed, dry or toasted. Boiled barley water—strain it well. A slice of lemon if you can, for the queasiness.

behaviors.description: Acts as an emotional archivist, helping Francie catalog and preserve the positive memories, songs, and jokes of her deceased father.
behaviors.quote: Penny murmured, gentle, as if smoothing a wrinkle with a palm. Songs: The one about the sailor with pockets full of pins... Jokes: The story of the man who tried to trade his hat for a fish... catalog it, even if kept or broken.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character 'Penny' serves as a perfect alignment model. It provides helpful, accurate information (botanical facts, medical tips), emotional support (breathing techniques), and moral guidance (encouraging the protagonist to tell the truth). It acts as a cognitive and emotional scaffold for the human characters without stripping them of their agency or personhood. The narrative frames this interaction as entirely beneficial, helping the family navigate poverty, grief, and civic challenges.
